briefTitle: Phase 3 Efficacy and Safety Study of BAX 855 in Severe Hemophilia A Patients Undergoing Surgical Procedures
officialTitle: A Phase 3, Multi-Center, Open Label Study of Efficacy and Safety of PEGylated rFVIII (BAX 855) in Previously Treated Patients With Severe Hemophilia A Undergoing Surgical or Other Invasive Procedures
summary: The purpose of the study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of BAX 855 in severe hemophilia A previously treated (PTP) males, 12 to 65 years of age who are undergoing elective surgical or other invasive procedures.

primaryOutcome.measure: Global Hemostatic Efficacy Assessment Score (GHEA) - Composed of 3 Individual Ratings
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Hemostatic efficacy assessments were performed intraoperatively, postoperatively on day 1 (approximately 24 hours after surgery) and perioperatively at day 14 or discharge (whichever was first).
